Detailed Description

Abstract base class for all thermodynamic databases.

This provides the construct for self registering thermodynamic database types so that it is possible to dynamically select which database a user would like to use. All thermodynamic database classes must provide the functionality listed below as well as a constructor which takes only a std::vector<Species>& as arguments. Note that the cv() is implemented using the relation \(Cv/Ru = Cp/Ru - 1\), therefore it does not need to be implemented for concrete types of this class.

Definition at line 50 of file ThermoDB.h.

Member Function Documentation

◆ cp()

virtual void cp ( double  Th,
double  Te,
double  Tr,
double  Tv,
double  Tel,
double *const  cp = NULL,
double *const  cpt = NULL,
double *const  cpr = NULL,
double *const  cpv = NULL,
double *const  cpel = NULL 
)
pure virtual

Computes the unitless species specific heats at constant pressure \( C_{p,i}/R_U\) of each species in thermal nonequilibrium.

Parameters
Th- heavy particle translational temperatures
Te- free electron temperature
Tr- mixture rotational temperature
Tv- mixture vibrational temperature
Tel- mixture electronic temperature
cp- if not NULL, the array of species non-dimensional cp
cpt- if not NULL, the array of species translational cp
cpr- if not NULL, the array of species rotational cp
cpv- if not NULL, the array of species vibrational cp
cpel- if not NULL, the array of species electronic cp

Implemented in RrhoDB, NasaDB< PolynomialType >, NasaDB< Nasa7Polynomial >, and NasaDB< Nasa9Polynomial >.

◆ cpint()

void cpint ( double  T,
double *const  cp 
)
virtual

Computes the unitless internal specific heat.

The default behavior is to simply provide \(c_{p,\text{int}} = c_p(T) - 2.5\) for all species.

Parameters
Ttemperature assigned to internal energy modes

◆ enthalpy()

virtual void enthalpy ( double  Th,
double  Te,
double  Tr,
double  Tv,
double  Tel,
double *const  h,
double *const  ht,
double *const  hr,
double *const  hv,
double *const  hel,
double *const  hf 
)
pure virtual

Computes the unitless species enthalpy \( h_i/R_U T_h\) of each species in thermal nonequilibrium, which is non-dimensionalized by the heavy particle translational temperature.

Parameters
Th- heavy particle translational temperature
Te- free electron temperature
Tr- mixture rotational temperature
Tv- mixture vibrational temperature
Tel- mixture electronic temperature
h- on return, the array of species non-dimensional enthalpies
ht- if not NULL, the array of species translational enthalpies
hr- if not NULL, the array of species rotational enthalpies
hv- if not NULL, the array of species vibrational enthalpies
hel- if not NULL, the array of species electronic enthalpies
hf- if not NULL, the array of the species formation enthalpies

Implemented in RrhoDB, NasaDB< PolynomialType >, NasaDB< Nasa7Polynomial >, and NasaDB< Nasa9Polynomial >.

pure virtual

Computes the unitless species entropy \(s_i/R_u\) allowing for thermal nonequilibrium.

Parameters
Th- heavy particle translational temperature
Te- free electron temperature
Tr- mixture rotational temperature
Tv- mixture vibrational temperature
Tel- mixture electronic temperature
P- mixture static pressure
s- on return, the array of species non-dimensional entropies
st- if not NULL, the array of species translational entropies
sr- if not NULL, the array of species rotational entropies
sv- if not NULL, the array of species vibrational entropies
sel- if not NULL, the array of species electronic entropies

Implemented in RrhoDB, NasaDB< PolynomialType >, NasaDB< Nasa7Polynomial >, and NasaDB< Nasa9Polynomial >.

)
pure virtual

Computes the unitless Gibbs free energy of each species i, \(G_i / R_u T_h\) where \(G_i\) is non-dimensionalized by the heavy particle translational temperature.

Parameters
Th- heavy particle translational temperature
Te- free electron temperature
Tr- mixture rotational temperature
Tv- mixture vibrational temperature
Tel- mixture electronic temperature
P- mixture static pressure
g- on return, the array of species non-dimensional energies
gt- if not NULL, the array of species translational energies
gr- if not NULL, the array of species rotational energies
gv- if not NULL, the array of species vibrational energies
gel- if not NULL, the array of species electronic energies

Implemented in RrhoDB, NasaDB< PolynomialType >, NasaDB< Nasa7Polynomial >, and NasaDB< Nasa9Polynomial >.

◆ loadAvailableSpecies()

virtual void loadAvailableSpecies ( std::list< Species > &  species)
protectedpure virtual

Implemented by the concrete class which fills the species vector with all of the species available in the database.

Note that this is only called once in the constructor.

Implemented in NasaDB< PolynomialType >, NasaDB< Nasa7Polynomial >, NasaDB< Nasa9Polynomial >, and RrhoDB.

◆ loadThermodynamicData()

virtual void loadThermodynamicData ( )
protectedpure virtual

Implemented by the concrete class which loads any data from the database required to compute the necessary thermodynamic quantities.

This is function is called during a call to load() after the list of species that are needed has been determined.

Implemented in RrhoDB, NasaDB< PolynomialType >, NasaDB< Nasa7Polynomial >, and NasaDB< Nasa9Polynomial >.
